Another example (although not boolean) is from Sun's JAI.  The real
offenders are now mercifully deprecated but some of these caused me quite
a lot of headscratching:

create(String opName, RenderedImage src, float param1, int param2, float
param3, float param4, Object param5) 

create(String opName, RenderedImage src, Object param1, Object param2,
Object param3, Object param4, Object param5, Object param6) 

http://java.sun.com/products/java-media/jai/forDevelopers/jai-apidocs/javax/
media/jai/JAI.html

> 
> In other words, a method like doIt(myObject, anotherObject, true, 
> false, true, true);
